content: By & large I usually don't recall my dreams. Usually a foggy recololection & soon fades. But the other night I had a stark dream & it's stayed with me a few days now. I dreamt I was on a side road in a car, over hanging trees shading the road. I looked up into a clear blue sky & saw Blackhawk going overhead which was on fire from about where the tailboom connects on aft. I was trying to dial 911 & was having the hardest time dialing. Once I got through it was harder to describe the direction the A/C was travelling, even though I knew the town I was in & where it appeared to be going. Like I said, dreams don't usually stay with me or what they were about, but this one has & I guess I'm a little freaked out by it.
reply: By & large I usually don't recall my dreams. Usually a foggy recololection & soon fades. But the other night I had a stark dream & it's stayed with me a few days now. Like I said, dreams don't usually stay with me or what they were about, but this one has & I guess I'm a little freaked out by it.
title: Dreams

content: I drept of my late husband I was in a mobile home with several people including my husband, the people began to move out and Floyd was one of them. I asked where he was going he said "honey you can't go where I'm going." I saw him leave without me and I woke up crying

content: A "gifted" eldery lady once told me long ago that if you see the whole person in a dream, head to toe while he/she is standing, you are not dreaming but experiencing "astral projection". In other words, you were there.

content: quote: Originally posted by stormer73: I drept of my late husband I was in a mobile home with several people including my husband, the people began to move out and Floyd was one of them. I asked where he was going he said "honey you can't go where I'm going." I saw him leave without me and I woke up crying My Grandmother died in october. She was 100 years old. She pretty much raised me when I was ery young. (Mom was a carhop and always working). I had just pulled into a McDonald's parking lot next to Knotts Berry Farm when I got this strange uprecedented feeling of contentment and that everything was going to be alright. A few seconds later my brother called me with the news that my Grandma had passed away. It was like that feeling was her parting gift/message. Things like that convince me there is more here than we can understand.

title: Dreams

content: I am huge on dreams and dreaming. I believe it a good idea to keep a "dream journal" close by the bed and write whatever you remember from every sleep (even naps), even before or while making morning water. Whatever of substance that dreams may hold can best be appreciated after collecting/assembling recuring dream symbols and comparing to archtypes. Some dreams are just entertainment, others can be communication from "beyond", precognition, or, maybe, just indigestion. I love em all. "Your old men will dream dreams and your young men will see visions", RSV.

content: trying to remember your dreams is good for the brain (my opinion) and makes it stronger... also, the better you get at dream remembering you will find you can begin to manipulate your dreams... dreams are cool, most times anyway. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

title: Dreams

content: Some dreams are just dreams, for instance, last night Dennis and I were discussing Paul McCartney and his ex. How much she got, blah blah blah. I made the remark, I'd marry him for 30 M or just for 1 M. So last night I had a dream of a British man. I remember that cause he spoke with a British accent. I have also had dreams of my mom after she died. She had RA, wheel chair. In my dreams she was walking. I had these dreams of her when I was going thru my divorce with my first. I have her bedroom furniture, dad gave it to me. One night I was sitting in the cowboy room, no noise. And I heard one of the handles on her dresser. I ran in there to see if a cat was in there, there was no cat in the room. I don't know if I was hoping or did I really hear it.

title: Dreams

content: Dreams and this discussion of them makes me a little uncomfortable. Like everyone else, I have had the normal variety of dreams. I have had a few complex dreams that have predicted moments that have occurred in my life. They were actually quite accurate, but I somehow misunderstood their meaning until the actual moment the event occurred. Felt kinda like figuring out a joke's punch line a little late. There is still one dream from many years ago, of events to come that is a great burden to have. Parts of it are already proven to me. Some dreams may be best forgotten. I am not sure what to make of this one-time dream I can't forget and just how to understand its meaning. It seems to be a message for someone I haven't even met yet. Somehow, I am supposed to know to tell a particular person of the dream. The particular timing of this topic coming up, and some of you sharing your dreams, is the only reason I am discussing any of this. I hope this is not a mistake I make. Hope that your dreams are peaceful and nothing more. This message has been edited. Last edited by: catahoulagill, Fri 06 March 2009 07:07 PM

content: I had a dream, Jane Fonda and Hilly C. bought me dinner at Tavern On The Green in New York. We drank until 2 am, I never had a nightmare before! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: I have nightmares, sweet dreams and crazy dreams. I always dream several dreams a night and wake up often because of them. The best dreams I have are of me flying. No aircraft, just lifting off the ground, feeling weightless and watching the ground and trees pass by below.

title: Dreams

content: How about yer military unit, all your buddies with their gear, all lined up to get on the transports and head for the war, and you can't find your stuff. Their all getting on and leaving, and you can't get there - your duffle is empty or busting open, you can't find yer combat boots, yer uniform is all tattered and ragged, ya can't find yer paperwork - and the jets have closed their ramps and are taxing away for take off - - - -and you never see them again... Or the colun of tanks trundle away without you. Leaving you in all that dust...or standing there in the snow - - and they don't come backk - - Some times I'll go through that night after night for weeks. Just mentioning it will probably cause it tonight - ahey Wandering and Wondering

I kinda evvy you.

content: I usually don't dream, or if I do, I don't remember them. On the few times I have had a dream, it was more like reliving the past and always bad or scary things, never warm and fuzzy.

title: Dreams

content: My brother died about '80 (at 39 yo). Shortly thereafter I dreamed of him, he said to me, "You're right". I never took that to be a carte blanch capitulation to my superior intellect/opinion. See, he was an atheist but, as he lay, insensate but afraid, dying of cancer in intersive care, I held his hand and coached him on what I believed he could expect to happen. I instinctively believe that's what he was telling me I was right about. That and God, basically. Of course, I could be deluded. btw, I baptised him minutes before he passed. I know, I know, it don't count unless one believes and repents but the least I could do was offer him the chance to repent before God and believe, in his silence. He tried to cringe away as I approached with a glass of water and told him what I intended but then, he just submitted, all peaceful. Did I do good? or just torture the poor guy? I expect to find out...later.

reply: Dreams and this discussion of them makes me a little uncomfortable. Like everyone else, I have had the normal variety of dreams. I have had a few complex dreams that have predicted moments that have occurred in my life. They were actually quite accurate, but I somehow misunderstood their meaning until the actual moment the event occurred. Felt kinda like figuring out a joke's punch line a little late. There is still one dream from many years ago, of events to come that is a great burden to have. Parts of it are already proven to me. Some dreams may be best forgotten. I am not sure what to make of this one-time dream I can't forget and just how to understand its meaning. It seems to be a message for someone I haven't even met yet. Somehow, I am supposed to know to tell a particular person of the dream. The particular timing of this topic coming up, and some of you sharing your dreams, is the only reason I am discussing any of this. I hope this is not a mistake I make. Hope that your dreams are peaceful and nothing more. This message has been edited. Last edited by: catahoulagill, Fri 06 March 2009 07:07 PM
title: Dreams

content: I had a dream, Jane Fonda and Hilly C. bought me dinner at Tavern On The Green in New York. We drank until 2 am, I never had a nightmare before! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
reply: I had a dream, Jane Fonda and Hilly C. bought me dinner at Tavern On The Green in New York. We drank until 2 am, I never had a nightmare before! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
title: Dreams

content: I have nightmares, sweet dreams and crazy dreams. I always dream several dreams a night and wake up often because of them. The best dreams I have are of me flying. No aircraft, just lifting off the ground, feeling weightless and watching the ground and trees pass by below.

title: Dreams

content: How about yer military unit, all your buddies with their gear, all lined up to get on the transports and head for the war, and you can't find your stuff. Their all getting on and leaving, and you can't get there - your duffle is empty or busting open, you can't find yer combat boots, yer uniform is all tattered and ragged, ya can't find yer paperwork - and the jets have closed their ramps and are taxing away for take off - - - -and you never see them again... Or the colun of tanks trundle away without you. Leaving you in all that dust...or standing there in the snow - - and they don't come backk - - Some times I'll go through that night after night for weeks. Just mentioning it will probably cause it tonight - ahey Wandering and Wondering

Hope that your dreams are peaceful and nothing more. I have friends who fear their dreams or carry dread of them around. Old dreams seem to take on a life of their own, we can confuse the original symbols with subsequent thoughts we unavoidably have of them. IF a dream is prophetic (I've had a couple that were insignificant but very entertaining...and a 'verified" dejavue (sp)) there's probably not a damn thing you can do about it except wait and see...and act as your gut leads. I kinda evvy you.

content: I usually don't dream, or if I do, I don't remember them. On the few times I have had a dream, it was more like reliving the past and always bad or scary things, never warm and fuzzy.
reply: I usually don't dream, or if I do, I don't remember them. On the few times I have had a dream, it was more like reliving the past and always bad or scary things, never warm and fuzzy.
title: Dreams

content: My brother died about '80 (at 39 yo). Shortly thereafter I dreamed of him, he said to me, "You're right". I never took that to be a carte blanch capitulation to my superior intellect/opinion. See, he was an atheist but, as he lay, insensate but afraid, dying of cancer in intersive care, I held his hand and coached him on what I believed he could expect to happen. I instinctively believe that's what he was telling me I was right about. That and God, basically. Of course, I could be deluded. btw, I baptised him minutes before he passed. I know, I know, it don't count unless one believes and repents but the least I could do was offer him the chance to repent before God and believe, in his silence. He tried to cringe away as I approached with a glass of water and told him what I intended but then, he just submitted, all peaceful. Did I do good? or just torture the poor guy? I expect to find out...later.

I expect to find out...later.
title: Dreams

content: By & large I usually don't recall my dreams. Usually a foggy recololection & soon fades. But the other night I had a stark dream & it's stayed with me a few days now. I dreamt I was on a side road in a car, over hanging trees shading the road. I looked up into a clear blue sky & saw Blackhawk going overhead which was on fire from about where the tailboom connects on aft. I was trying to dial 911 & was having the hardest time dialing. Once I got through it was harder to describe the direction the A/C was travelling, even though I knew the town I was in & where it appeared to be going. Like I said, dreams don't usually stay with me or what they were about, but this one has & I guess I'm a little freaked out by it.
reply: By & large I usually don't recall my dreams. Usually a foggy recololection & soon fades. But the other night I had a stark dream & it's stayed with me a few days now. content: I drept of my late husband I was in a mobile home with several people including my husband, the people began to move out and Floyd was one of them. I asked where he was going he said "honey you can't go where I'm going." I saw him leave without me and I woke up crying

content: A "gifted" eldery lady once told me long ago that if you see the whole person in a dream, head to toe while he/she is standing, you are not dreaming but experiencing "astral projection". In other words, you were there.

content: quote: Originally posted by stormer73: I drept of my late husband I was in a mobile home with several people including my husband, the people began to move out and Floyd was one of them. I asked where he was going he said "honey you can't go where I'm going." I saw him leave without me and I woke up crying My Grandmother died in october. She was 100 years old. She pretty much raised me when I was ery young. (Mom was a carhop and always working). I had just pulled into a McDonald's parking lot next to Knotts Berry Farm when I got this strange uprecedented feeling of contentment and that everything was going to be alright. A few seconds later my brother called me with the news that my Grandma had passed away. It was like that feeling was her parting gift/message. Things like that convince me there is more here than we can understand.

title: Dreams

content: I am huge on dreams and dreaming. I believe it a good idea to keep a "dream journal" close by the bed and write whatever you remember from every sleep (even naps), even before or while making morning water. Whatever of substance that dreams may hold can best be appreciated after collecting/assembling recuring dream symbols and comparing to archtypes. Some dreams are just entertainment, others can be communication from "beyond", precognition, or, maybe, just indigestion. I love em all. "Your old men will dream dreams and your young men will see visions", RSV.

content: trying to remember your dreams is good for the brain (my opinion) and makes it stronger... also, the better you get at dream remembering you will find you can begin to manipulate your dreams... dreams are cool, most times anyway. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

title: Dreams

content: Some dreams are just dreams, for instance, last night Dennis and I were discussing Paul McCartney and his ex. How much she got, blah blah blah. I made the remark, I'd marry him for 30 M or just for 1 M. So last night I had a dream of a British man. I remember that cause he spoke with a British accent. I have also had dreams of my mom after she died. She had RA, wheel chair. In my dreams she was walking. I had these dreams of her when I was going thru my divorce with my first. I have her bedroom furniture, dad gave it to me. One night I was sitting in the cowboy room, no noise. And I heard one of the handles on her dresser. I ran in there to see if a cat was in there, there was no cat in the room. I don't know if I was hoping or did I really hear it.

title: Dreams

content: Dreams and this discussion of them makes me a little uncomfortable. Like everyone else, I have had the normal variety of dreams. I have had a few complex dreams that have predicted moments that have occurred in my life. They were actually quite accurate, but I somehow misunderstood their meaning until the actual moment the event occurred. Felt kinda like figuring out a joke's punch line a little late. There is still one dream from many years ago, of events to come that is a great burden to have. Parts of it are already proven to me. Some dreams may be best forgotten. I am not sure what to make of this one-time dream I can't forget and just how to understand its meaning. It seems to be a message for someone I haven't even met yet. Somehow, I am supposed to know to tell a particular person of the dream. The particular timing of this topic coming up, and some of you sharing your dreams, is the only reason I am discussing any of this. I hope this is not a mistake I make. Hope that your dreams are peaceful and nothing more. This message has been edited. Last edited by: catahoulagill, Fri 06 March 2009 07:07 PM

quote: Originally posted by catahoulagill: Dreams and this discussion of them makes me a little uncomfortable... There is still one dream from many years ago, of events to come that is a great burden to have. Parts of it are already proven to me. Some dreams may be best forgotten. I am not sure what to make of this one-time dream I can't forget and just how to understand its meaning. It seems to be a message for someone I haven't even met yet. Somehow, I am supposed to know to tell a particular person of the dream. The particular timing of this topic coming up, and some of you sharing your dreams, is the only reason I am discussing any of this. I hope this is not a mistake I make. Hope that your dreams are peaceful and nothing more.
reply: I have friends who fear their dreams or carry dread of them around. Old dreams seem to take on a life of their own, we can confuse the original symbols with subsequent thoughts we unavoidably have of them. IF a dream is prophetic (I've had a couple that were insignificant but very entertaining...and a 'verified" dejavue (sp)) there's probably not a damn thing you can do about it except wait and see...and act as your gut leads. I kinda evvy you.
title: Dreams

content: I usually don't dream, or if I do, I don't remember them. On the few times I have had a dream, it was more like reliving the past and always bad or scary things, never warm and fuzzy.
reply: I usually don't dream, or if I do, I don't remember them. On the few times I have had a dream, it was more like reliving the past and always bad or scary things, never warm and fuzzy.
title: Dreams

content: My brother died about '80 (at 39 yo). Shortly thereafter I dreamed of him, he said to me, "You're right". I never took that to be a carte blanch capitulation to my superior intellect/opinion. See, he was an atheist but, as he lay, insensate but afraid, dying of cancer in intersive care, I held his hand and coached him on what I believed he could expect to happen. I instinctively believe that's what he was telling me I was right about. That and God, basically. Of course, I could be deluded. btw, I baptised him minutes before he passed. I know, I know, it don't count unless one believes and repents but the least I could do was offer him the chance to repent before God and believe, in his silence. He tried to cringe away as I approached with a glass of water and told him what I intended but then, he just submitted, all peaceful. Did I do good? or just torture the poor guy? I expect to find out...later.
